Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the IAD erred in concluding that Mr. Malhi was not a member of the family class due to non-genuine marriage
Crimes.Procedural_Context: Judicial review under subsection 72(1) of the IRPA
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Mr. Malhi lacked knowledge about Ms. Froment’s children and personal background
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Testimonial and documentary evidence regarding marital relationship
Crimes.Legal_Provision: Section 4 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Marriage was genuine and should qualify under family class sponsorship
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Age difference, language barriers, religious differences, lack of mutual knowledge
Crimes.Regulation_Cited: Section 4 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Crimes.Application_Error: Alleged error in assessing genuineness of marriage
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Marriage must be genuine and not primarily for immigration purposes
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Rejection of permanent residence application sustained
Crimes.Authority: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, subsection 72(1)
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Reasonableness of IAD's conclusion on marriage genuineness
Crimes.Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Section 4 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Marriage not found to be genuine
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Cited: Section 4 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Lack of detailed knowledge about spouse’s personal life
Crimes.Credibility_Issues: Doubt cast on authenticity of marital relationship
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Claim that IAD incorrectly deemed marriage insincere
Crimes.Relevant_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act and Regulations
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Standard of review in administrative appeals
Crimes.Omission_Type: Failure to provide sufficient personal details about spouse
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility: Ineligibility under family class due to suspected marriage of convenience

Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the IAD erred in concluding that Mr. Malhi’s marriage was not authentic
Crimes.Procedural_Context: Judicial review under subsection 72(1) of the IRPA
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Mr. Malhi demonstrated insufficient knowledge of Ms. Froment’s personal history and children
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Testimonial and circumstantial evidence on marital authenticity
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Marriage was genuine and should qualify for sponsorship
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Age gap, language differences, religious disparity, lack of shared life details
Crimes.Regulation_Cited: Section 4 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Crimes.Application_Error: Allegation of incorrect credibility assessment by IAD
Crimes.Review_Outcome: Decision upheld; no patent unreasonableness found
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Marriage must be genuine and not entered primarily for immigration benefit
Crimes.Application_Factor: Authenticity and depth of spousal relationship
Crimes.Authority: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, subsection 72(1)
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Reasonableness of IAD’s determination on marriage legitimacy
Crimes.Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Section 4 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Cited: Section 4 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Insufficient proof of shared personal knowledge
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: Appeal process adhered to procedural norms
Crimes.Credibility_Issues: Serious doubts about sincerity of marital bond
Crimes.Relevant_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act and Regulations
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Scope of judicial review over administrative decisions
Crimes.Omission_Type: Failure to demonstrate intimate knowledge of spouse
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility: Inadmissibility based on suspected marriage fraud
